intro: Archidendropsis fournieri var. fournieri, commonly known as the Fournier's archidendropsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Uganda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
